content.description: I don’t have any FA info/original route name or even if this is the standard route up this face, but it’s too good not to share. Start with your hands matched down and left of the face in a triangular hole.  Work your way up and right through thin holds to gain a great jug. Grab the lip and mantle over.
content.protection: One pad. Great for a solo sesh.
content.location: The relatively short, overhung face on the biggest boulder.

content.description: Sit start the flake and climb it to the top. Fun moves but over way to quickly.
content.location: On the smaller boulder that is just to the left of the big boulder. This climbs the flake from a sit start that faces the rest stop.

content.description: crux is mantling the shelf   make your way up the V slot on the left
under cling, side pull, lie back, mantle
content.location: just in front of you when walking up to the Large Marge boulder from the parking lot

content.description: Glacial Erratics    -about 10 routes with good movement ranging from V0-V5 and possibly higher   -Never other climbers here but I have found that it has been climbed on   -This area has a day's worth of climbing but not more   -also a good spot right off the highway for a quick "on the way to work" session if you live North and work in Concord or Manchester
